message.content:
Day 1:
Breakfast: Oatmeal with fresh fruits and cinnamon.
Lunch: Quinoa salad with mixed vegetables, cherry tomatoes, bell peppers, and olive oil dressing.
Dinner: Baked chicken breast with steamed broccoli and brown rice.
Snacks: Fresh fruits like bananas, apples or berries.

Day 2:
Breakfast: Smoothie made from mixed fruits and veggies (avoiding garlic), water or coconut water as a base.
Lunch: Green salad with avocado, cucumber, carrots, and chickpeas. Topped with lemon juice and olive oil.
Dinner: Grilled salmon with sweet potato mash and sautéed spinach.
Snacks: Carrot and celery sticks with hummus.

Day 3:
Breakfast: Scrambled tofu with mixed vegetables, turmeric, and black pepper. Serve it with whole-grain bread or gluten-free toast.
Lunch: Spinach and lentil soup.
Dinner: Baked eggplant stuffed with quinoa and veggies, served with a side of grilled zucchini.
Snacks: Fresh fruits like bananas, apples, or berries.

Day 4:
Breakfast: Avocado toast on gluten-free bread topped with cherry tomatoes and drizzled with olive oil.
Lunch: Grilled portobello mushroom cap sandwich with lettuce, tomato, and vegan mayo on whole-grain bread.
Dinner: Lentil curry with basmati rice and roasted cauliflower florets.
Snacks: A handful of dried fruits like raisins or apricots.

Day 5:
Breakfast: Chia seed pudding made with almond milk, topped with fresh berries and shredded coconut.
Lunch: Veggie stir-fry with brown rice and sesame seeds.
Dinner: Stuffed bell peppers with quinoa, black beans, and corn.
Snacks: A handful of nuts like pistachios or cashews (excluding almonds and almond butter).

Day 6:
Breakfast: Green smoothie bowl made from mixed fruits and greens, topped with banana slices, chia seeds, and hemp seeds.
Lunch: Vegan sushi rolls filled with avocado, cucumber, and carrots.
Dinner: Roasted chickpea salad with kale, chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, olives, and a lemon tahini dressing.
Snacks: Fresh fruits like bananas, apples, or berries.

Day 7:
Breakfast: Buckwheat pancakes served with fresh fruit and maple syrup (avoid honey).
Lunch: Lentil soup with a side of mixed greens salad and olive oil dressing.
Dinner: Stuffed bell peppers with quinoa, black beans, and corn.
Snacks: A handful of dried fruits like raisins or apricots.

Remember to stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water throughout the day. Enjoy your healthy meal plan!
